citeinfo.origin: Rice, K.G., J.H. Waddle, M.E. Crockett, B.M. Jeffery, and H.F. Percival
citeinfo.title: Herpetofaunal Inventories of the National Parks - Biscayne

descript.abstract: The Comprehensive Everglades Restoration Plan (CERP) requires the use of ecological indicators to measure the success of restoration efforts. The Everglades amphibian community is ideal because amphibians are present in all habitats and under all hydrologic regimes. During Everglades restoration, hydrologic patterns will change and the response of ecological indicators will determine success. Fourteen amphibian species were detected through VES, vocalization surveys and trapping methods throughout the study and the occurrence information collected in this project database.
descript.purpose: Collect baseline data on the status of amphibian populations in Biscayne National Park.

spdom.descgeog: Biscayne Bay National Park, Florida, USA

idinfo.accconst: The original dataset contains many fields with information such as environmental variables, observers/collectors, and field notes associated with each record. Use the 'Point of Contact' in this document for a complete list of, and to gain access to, fields associated with this subset of the original dataset.
idinfo.datacred: Kenneth G. Rice, J. Hardin Waddle, Marquette E. Crockett, Christopher D. Bugbee, Brian M. Jeffery, and H. Franklin Percival

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing sample collection environmental variables

attr.attrdef: The unique primary key field automatically assigned by Access.
The date and time the record was created in the database.
The plot number.
The date on which the plot was sampled.
The month the plot was sampled (for use when dividing up plot samples by visits for PAO analysis).
[No description given in database or in associated reports]
The weather at the time plot was sampled. Choices are: "Clear" "Partly Cloudy" "Cloudy" "Rain" "Fog" "Other".

edom.edomvd: Weather conditions different than the above choices

attr.attrdef: The wind strength at the time plot was sampled. Choices are: "None" "Light" "Moderate" "Strong".
Air temperature in celsius to one decimal place.
The relative humidity to the nearest percent.
Whether or not there was standing water when the plot was sampled.

edom.edomvd: Standing water was present at location
Standing water was not present at location

attr.attrdef: The water temperature in degrees Celsius to the nearest half degree if there is water.
The initials of the people who sampled the plot.
Check by the methods used in the plot.
Any notes about the plot.
The unique identifier within this database that relates the plot information to the samples and observations.
The Universal Transverse Mercator "X" coordinate of the plot based on UTM Zone 17R with the WGS84 datum.
The Universal Transverse Mercator "Y" coordinate of the plat based on UTM Zone 17R and the WGS84 datum.
General description of the habitat type of the area within and around the plot.
Name of the park or refuge in which the point is located.
Name of the NPS Management Unit (or island in BISC) in which the point is located.
The identifier used to denote this study in the across south Florida analyses. Designated BISC for these sites; not given to sites excluded in this analysis.
The unique number of the site used in analyses across all south Florida studies; not given to sites excluded in these analyses (e.g. because it was sampled in the wrong time of year or on an island).
The habitat categories used in the across south Florida Anolis occupancy analysis; not given to sites excluded in this analysis.
The distance to the nearest road (in m) used in the across south Florida Anolis occupancy analysis; not given to sites excluded in this analysis.
The habitat categories used in the across south Florida anuran occupancy analysis; not given to sites excluded in this analysis.
Notes about the unique characteristics of the plot

enttyp.enttypd: table contains information about the species recorded in the database

attr.attrdef: The three letter code assigned to each species in this project. Usually the first letter of the genus followed by the first two letters of the specific epithet.
The taxonomic class of each species (Reptile or Amphibian).
The taxonomic order of the species, or order/suborder in the case of the reptiles
The taxonomic family of the species
The genus to which the species belongs.
The specific epithet of the species' scientific name.
The sub specific designation if any is recognized.
The official common name of the species.
Whether the species is considered introduced to this area.

edom.edomvd: Species is introduced to this area
Species is not introduced to this area

attr.attrdef: Whether the species is found in Miami-Dade County (based on UF museum records).

edom.edomvd: Species is found in Miami-Dade County
Species not found in Miami-Dade County

attr.attrdef: Believed to be found in Biscayne National Park based on results of this study or of previous sightings documented by Biscayne National Park.

edom.edomvd: Species believed to be in Biscayne National Park.
Species not believed to be in Biscayne National Park.

attr.attrdef: Whether or not the species appears on the list of documented species from www.nps.gov/bisc website.

edom.edomvd: Species not listed on park website.

attr.attrdef: Whether this species was detected during this study.

edom.edomvd: Species was detected during this study.
Species was not detected during this study.

attr.attrdef: Whether this species was detected during a visual encounter survey.

edom.edomvd: Species was detected during a visual encounter survey.
Species was not detected during a visual encounter survey.

attr.attrdef: Whether this species was detected during a vocalization survey.

edom.edomvd: Species was detected during a vocalization survey.
Species was not detected during a vocalization survey.

attr.attrdef: Whether this species was detected opportunistically.
From Rare and Endangered Biota of Florida: Vol III. Amphibians and Reptiles. 1992. Paul Moler, ed. University Press of Florida, Gainesville, FL, USA
Any cmments about this species pertaining to this study area.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing visual encounter survey data

attr.attrdef: The unique primary key value automatically assigned by Access.
Relates this table to tblPlotData where information about the sample is stored (i.e. date, time, weather).
The three letter code for the species, see tbl_speciesList for an explanation
The SVL of the animal in mm if it was captured.
The age of the animal. Choices are: "Egg" "Larva" "Juvenile" "SubAdult" "Adult" "Undetermined".
The sex of the animal if it can be determined.
The substrate on which the animal was found.
Estimate of the perch height of the animal in cm.
Record any comments about the condition or behavior of the animal.
The primary key field, automatically assigned by access
Links this table to the data collected for the plot in tblPlotData
The time at which the survey began.
The estimated abundance of the number of cricket frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which cricket frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of giant toads calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which giant toads were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of oak toads calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which oak toads were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of southern toads calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which southern toads were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of greenhouse frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which greenhouse frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of eastern narrowmouth frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which eastern narrowmouth frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of green treefrogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which green treefrogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of squirrell treefrogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which squirrell treefrogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of Cuban treefrogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which Cuban treefrogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of chorus frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which chorus frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of little grass frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which little grass frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of pig frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which pig frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
The estimated abundance of the number of leopoard frogs calling. 0=none, 1=1 calling, 2=2-5 calling, 3=6-10 calling, 4=>10 calling, 5= large chorus.
The intensity with which leopoard frogs were calling, 0=none, 1=Occasional, 2=Frequent, 3=Continuous.
Any notes that apply to the call survey.

enttyp.enttypd: table containing opportunistic visual encounters with target animals

attr.attrdef: Unique field for each record of an opportunistic encounter.
Date of the encounter.
The code for the species that was detected (explained in the Species List Table).
Describes the condition of the animal at time of detection and release (Alive or Dead, Released or Collected).
The snout to vent or snout to urostyle length of the individual if it was captured and measured.
Estimate of the age group of the individual (Egg, Larva, Juvenile, Sub-Adult, Adult)
The gender of the individual (Male, Female, or Undetermined)
Four letter of code of the NPS property from which the observation was made.
X GPS coordinate of center of sampling point in UTM (WGS 84 datum).
Y GPS coordinate of center of sampling point in UTM (WGS 84 datum).
Initials of the observer who entered the record.
Any notes about this indivdual encounter.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
